APPENDIX D - EXTRATERRITORIAL JURISDICTION, SOUTHEASTERN INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT[1] 
ORDINANCE NO. 1964-5 
    AN ORDINANCE EXTENDING AND ESTABLISHING THE EXTRATERRITORIAL JURISDICTION OF THE CITY OF PORT NECHES OVER AND INCLUDING LAND LYING WITHIN SUCH EXTRATERRITORIAL JURISDICTION ESTABLISHING RULES AND REGULATIONS COVERING PLATS AND THE SUBDIVISION OF LAND, CREATING THE SOUTHEASTERN INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT THEREIN AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES. 
    WHEREAS, the land hereinafter described is presently within the exclusive extraterritorial jurisdiction of the City of Port neches, being surrounded by territory lying within said city by virtue of certain valid annexation ordinances; and 
    WHEREAS, most, if not all, of such land is owned by Goodrich-Gulf Chemicals, Inc., Texas-U.S. Chemical Company, Jefferson Chemical Company, Inc., American Cyanamid Company, and Texaco Inc., which said companies desire to have said land available for industrial and not municipal purposes to the end that industrial improvements may be made thereon which will improve the economy and be for the best interests for the citizens of Port Neches; and 
    WHEREAS, the city desires to avail itself of the provisions of the statutes known as V.T.C.A., Local Government Code chs. 42, 43 and 212, by creating an industrial district composed of said lands hereinafter described to be known as the "Southeastern Industrial District" of said city and by ratifying and confirming a contract entered into with certain owners of land within such area: 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF PORT NECHES, TEXAS: 
First: 
    The extraterritorial jurisdiction of the City of Port Neches, Texas, is hereby declared to extend to and be asserted over all of the lands hereinafter described to the exclusion of any other municipality, said lands lying and being situated in Jefferson County, Texas, being completely surrounded by lands lying within the corporate boundaries of said city, to wit: 
Beginning at a point on the easterly line of Main Street, projected, said point being 235 feet more or less north, as measured along said easterly line, of the north right-of-way line of State Highway No. 347; 
Thence in a northerly direction along the easterly line of Main Street to a point for a corner, said point being the southeast corner of the Industrial Addition to Port Neches, Texas, the plat and dedication being recorded in Volume 3 and Volume 8, of the map records of Jefferson County, Texas, to which reference is hereby made for the purpose of identity; 
Thence north 81 degrees 43 minutes 38 seconds west for a distance of 940.00 feet to a point for a corner; 
Thence north 8 degrees 16 minutes 22 seconds east for a distance of 2,011 feet more or less to a point for a corner on the south right-of-way line of Texas State Highway No. F.M. 366; 
Thence south 81 degrees 43 minutes 38 seconds east, along the south right-of-way line of said highway, 95 feet, to a point for a corner; 
Thence north 8 degrees 16 minutes 22 seconds east 2,634.0 feet, more or less, to a point for a corner, said point being 35 feet south of, measured at right angles to, the south boundary line of Avenue "L" (as the same appears by map or plat of the Rachford and Dearing Subdivision to the City of Port Neches, Jefferson County, Texas, recorded in Volume 4, page 6, of the map records of Jefferson County, Texas); 
Thence south 81 degrees 43 minutes 38 seconds east 845 feet to a point for a corner, said point lying on the east line of Main Street, said east line also being the division line between Division No. 3 and 4 of the Thomas F. McKinney League; 
Thence north 8 degrees 16 minutes 22 seconds east along the east line of Main Street 3,758.5 feet more or less to a point for a corner, said point being the intersection of said street with the westerly extension of the south boundary line of Lot 4, Block 1 of the Riverside Terrace Subdivision adjacent to the City of Port Neches; 
Thence, at right angles east and along the south boundary line of Lots 4 and 5, in Block 1 of said Riverside Terrace Subdivision, to a point for a corner said point being the southeast corner of Lot 5 in said Block 1; 
Thence northerly along the east boundary line of Lots 5 to 8, inclusive, in Block 1, of said Riverside Terrace Subdivision, across Avenue "A," and continuing along the east boundary of Block No. 2 of said Riverside Terrace Subdivision, to a point for a corner, said point being 150 feet southerly from, measured at right angles to the west bank of the Neches River; 
Thence in a southeasterly direction with a line paralleling the meanders of the west bank of the Neches River, at a distance of 150 feet from, measured at right angles thereto, to a point on the common property line of Texaco Inc. and Jefferson Chemical Company, Inc.; 
Thence southerly following the meander of the Neches River and 150.0 feet, measured at right angles, from the west bank of said river according to the following calls using Jefferson Chemical Company bearings: South 82 degrees 37 minutes 30 seconds east approximately 1,025.84 feet to a point;

Thence north 10 degrees 27 minutes east (using Port Arthur Land Company bearings) along the common property line of Texaco Inc. and Jefferson Chemical Company, Inc. for a distance of 412 feet more or less to its intersection with the southeasterly projection of a line across Spur 136, etc., that parallels, on the north side thereof at 200 feet measured at right angles to, the north right-of-way line of State Highway No. 347; 
Thence north 79 degrees 33 minutes west along said projection across the properties of Texaco Inc., the Texas Pipe Line Company, the Kansas City Southern Railway Company and Spur 136 for a distance of 391 feet more or less to a point on the property of Neches Butane Products Company for a corner; 
Thence north 48 degrees 47 minutes west along a line paralleling the north line of said highway, at a distance of 200 feet measured at right angles thereto, for a distance of 523 feet more or less to a point for a corner; 
Thence south 81 degrees 13 minutes west along a line paralleling the north line of said highway, at a distance of 200 feet measured at right angles thereto, for a distance of 431 feet more or less to a point for a corner; 
Thence north 48 degrees 47 minutes west along a line paralleling the north line of said highway, at a distance of 200 feet measured at right angles thereto, for a distance of 787 feet more or less to the point of beginning. 
Second: 
    All the land lying and being situated within the boundaries set forth in Paragraph First of this ordinance is hereby declared to lie and be within the extraterritorial jurisdiction of said city; and the boundaries of said city, for the limited purpose of exercising the extraterritorial jurisdiction, are hereby extended to include the territory so described in Paragraph First hereof. 
Third: 
    No owner of land lying within the boundaries described in Paragraph First hereof shall subdivide or plat the same except in strict accordance with the ordinances of the City of Port Neches regulating the preparation and filing of plats and subdivision of land lying within the said city. 
Fourth: 
    The territory described in Paragraph First hereof is hereby declared to be an industrial district as defined in V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 42.044, and shall be known as the Southeastern Industrial District of the City of Port Neches, Texas. 
Fifth: 
    That certain contract dated June 12, 1963, between Goodrich-Gulf Chemicals Inc., Texas-U.S. Chemical Company, Jefferson Chemical Company, Inc., American Cyanamid Company, and Texaco Inc., parties of the first part, and the City of Port Neches, Texas, party of the second part, pertaining to immunity from annexation of certain lands owned by such companies within the above-described area is hereby ratified and confirmed and in all respects validated under the provisions of V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 42.044. 
    Read, passed, and unanimously adopted this the 31st day of March, A.D. 1964.
